III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/12/24, two youth were found squatting behind an air
conditioning vent and their body language indicated that they had
engaged in sexual behavior with one another. The youth reside at
separate campuses but have been known to sneak off together. A
few weeks ago, they were found in a bathroom stall with one
another.
Investigation Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on November
20, 2024, and reported Youth E said she was sitting on the
ground talking with Youth A and “nothing happened.” Case
Manager stated she was not working when either situation took
place between Youth A and Youth E.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth A reported he goes for walks “a lot”
but never goes for a walk without staff. Youth A stated he has
walked over to Vassar House, with staff, and “waves hello.” Youth
A denied knowing Youth E or ever spending any time with Youth
E. Youth A stated, “I don’t know [Youth E] or who you are talking
about.” Youth A denied ever being AWOL, being found in Camp
One in a bathroom staff with Youth E by staff or ever being alone
with any of the youth from Vassar House. Youth A stated he was
not sure why anyone would say he was ever with Youth E. Youth
A had a smile on his face while answering all the questions.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth B denied being aware of a time
Youth A left the facility without staff. Youth B reported staff follow
youth when youth leave the unit or run away. Youth B stated,
“there is nothing staff can do when we leave.” Youth B reported
he has been on a unit by himself until recently, so he was not in
the same unit at Youth A.
2

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth C reported staff supervise youth all
the time and will try and get between the youth and the door if
youth are trying to leave the unit. Youth C denied being aware if
Youth A has left the unit. Youth C stated he has “heard things” but
would not elaborate on what he has heard. Youth C described
youth walking out of the unit in the past but stated he could not
recall the youths’ names or when it occurred. Youth C stated if
youth do get out of the unit staff follow the youth and call a
supervisor.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth D reported youth run off and
sometimes staff follow and sometimes staff do not follow. Youth D
refused to answer any questions.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth E described being in her unit and
hearing Youth A outside her unit. Youth E stated she went to the
unit door, peeked out and a staff (Youth E could not recall the
name of the staff) told Youth E to stay inside the unit. Youth E
reported she opened the door and began talking with Youth A.
Youth E stated, “I walked out the door even though not supposed
to.” Youth E reported there was only one staff working in the unit.
Youth E stated Youth G was in the shower and Youth F was in
bed. Youth E reported it was dark but did not know what time the
incident occurred. Youth E denied seeing a staff with Youth A.
Youth E reported when she walked out of the unit the staff working
did not follow because the staff had to stay in the unit with Youth F
and Youth G. Youth E described walking behind the unit with
Youth A and sitting on the ground by the air conditioning unit.
Youth E stated Supervisor 2 pulled up in a car and Supervisor 3
came running toward Youth A and Youth E. Youth E stated she
was out of the unit for 10 or 12 minutes before Supervisor 2 and
Supervisor 3 arrived. Youth E reported Supervisor 3 said, “they
were doing sexual stuff.” Youth E denied doing anything sexual
with Youth A. Youth E stated she was sitting on the ground with
her legs tucked up under her and Youth A was standing in front of
her with his hands in his pockets. Youth E reported they were
only talking. Youth E stated, “they were not hiding or trying to go
AWOL, we were just talking.”
Youth E denied running away with Youth A and being found in a
bathroom stall with Youth A by staff. Youth E stated she has
3

never run away with Youth A. Youth E reported she has never
had sex with Youth A.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Supervisor 3 described being the
Supervisor on duty at Vassar House the night Youth A and Youth
E were found outside by the air conditioning unit. Supervisor 3
stated he saw Youth E standing in the doorway talking to Youth A
who was outside. Supervisor 3 reported it was approximately
10:30pm and Staff 4 was in Youth E’s unit as Staff 3 just got off
shift but was still at the facility. Supervisor 3 stated he told Youth
E to get back into her unit and asked Youth A what he was doing
at Vassar House. Supervisor 3 denied seeing a staff with Youth
A. Supervisor 3 stated Youth E went back into her unit and Youth
A took off running. Supervisor 3 reported he saw Staff 3 and
asked Staff 3 to go talk with Youth E while he went to look for
Youth A. Supervisor 3 stated Staff 3 entered Youth E’s unit and
came back out and said Youth E was gone. Supervisor 3
described running around Vassar House, seeing Supervisor 2
drive his vehicle behind Vassar House and that is when
Supervisor 3 saw Youth A facing the wall rocking back and forth.
Supervisor 3 stated he yelled out to Youth A and Youth E jumped
up. Supervisor 3 reported he took Youth E back to her unit and
Supervisor 2 took Youth A back to Youth A’s campus.
Supervisor 3 stated he was not aware of Youth A and Youth E
being found in Camp One in a bathroom stall by staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Staff 1 stated he believed he was working
the night Youth A left the unit and ran to the girls’ campus. Staff 1
reported there have been a few nights where Youth A or different
youth have run or tried to leave the unit. Staff 1 stated if it was the
same night he was thinking it was, Staff 1 called Supervisor 2 and
reported Youth A had left the unit. Staff 1 reported he could not
leave the unit because there were other youth in the unit. Staff 1
reported Youth A left the unit sometime after 10pm because it was
shift change. Staff 1 stated Youth A returned to the unit with
Supervisor 2. Staff 1 could not recall how long Youth A was gone.
Staff 1 reported the youth often try and run out of the unit and go
to Vassar House to see the girls. Staff 1 stated when it is at night
and during sleep times staff try and redirect the youth and
convince the youth to stay but if the youth leaves the unit than the
supervisor on duty is called. Staff 1 described things being better
now because at the beginning of the month the units were
4

combined so all the youth are in one unit but so are the staff. Staff
1 reported now there are three to four staff in the unit during
awake hours so it is easier to follow youth if they run out of the
unit.
Staff 1 stated he did not know anything about Youth A and Youth
E being found in Camp One after going AWOL.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on December 3,
2024. Supervisor 1 stated he was not working the night Youth A
and Youth E were found outside Vassar House by the air
conditioning unit.
Supervisor 1 reported he along with Supervisor 2 found Youth A
and Youth E in Camp One in the bathroom stall after they had
been AWOL. Supervisor 1 stated this occurred over a month ago
and was around midnight. Supervisor described Youth A coming
out of the bathroom stall with his clothes on and Youth E
appeared to be adjusting her clothes. Supervisor 1 stated the
first-time checking Camp One the camp door was closed but
checking it a second time the back door to Camp One was
propped open. Supervisor 1 reported he had reported Youth A
and Youth E missing to Vassar Police. Supervisor 1 stated he
was the supervisor on duty that night along with Supervisor 2, who
had been out looking for the youth. Supervisor 1 could not recall
who was the staff working the night Youth E went AWOL and was
found in the bathroom stall.
Supervisor 1 stated when youth leave the unit during sleep hours
staff cannot follow the youth because of the other youth in the unit.
Supervisor 1 reported that is when staff call the supervisor on
duty.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 10,
2024. Supervisor 2 reported he was notified by staff (could not
recall what staff) Youth A left his unit and was suspected to be
going to Vassar House. Supervisor 2 stated he got in his car and
drove to Vassar House. Supervisor 2 reported it was between 10
– 10:30pm. Supervisor 2 described driving his car to Vassar
House and driving around toward the back of the building when he
saw Youth E sitting on the ground and Youth A standing in front of
Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A’s back was to Supervisor
2 when Supervisor 2 pulled up in the car. Supervisor 2 stated
Supervisor 3 came running from the other side of the building.
Supervisor 2 reported he took Youth A back to his unit and
Supervisor 3 took Youth E back to her unit. Supervisor 2 stated
5

he did not witness Youth A and Youth E having sexual intercourse
but Supervisor 3 told Supervisor 2 he thought they were.
Supervisor 2 stated Supervisor 3 came from a different angle so
maybe he did see something between the two youth. Supervisor
2 reported Youth A was gone less than 15 minutes from his unit
before being found.
Supervisor 2 stated he was the supervisor on duty when Youth A
and Youth E were found in the bathroom of Camp One.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A ran off the unit and ran to Vassar
House. Supervisor 2 described being with Youth A at Vassar
House, talking with Youth A to return to his unit. Supervisor 2
stated Youth E was standing in the doorway of her unit talking with
Youth A with Staff 5 standing right next to Youth E, trying to
convince Youth E to close the door and come back into the unit.
Supervisor 2 reported he was trying to get Youth A to return to his
unit, but he was refusing to walk back. Supervisor 2 reported
Youth A took off, it was dark, and Supervisor 2 could not see
where Youth A ran off. Supervisor 2 stated Youth E went back
into her unit and Supervisor 2 started to look for Youth A.
Supervisor 2 reported Supervisor 1 was also working and assisted
looking for Youth A. Supervisor 2 described hearing Youth E had
run out of her unit. Supervisor 2 reported the police were called
and Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 looked for Youth A and Youth
E. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A and Youth E were found in the
bathroom of Camp One. Supervisor 2 reported both youth had
been gone for maybe an hour before being located.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024. Staff 3 described being off shift and walking
from the breakroom to unit 2 when she saw Youth E standing in
the doorway of the unit and pushing her way through Staff 4 to get
out of the unit. Staff 3 stated Youth E went to the left and took off
running. Staff 3 reported it was around 10:30pm. Staff 3 denied
seeing Youth A at any time. Staff 3 stated she was on her way to
Unit 2 to use the restroom when Supervisor 2 came running
through. Staff 3 reported she was in the bathroom of Unit 2 and
could hear “some commotion” from behind the unit. Staff 3 stated
she heard some loud voices and that is when Supervisor 3 found
Youth A and Youth E. Staff 3 stated only a few minutes had
passed from when Youth E ran out of the unit until Youth E was
found by Supervisor 3 behind Vassar House.
Staff 3 stated she was not working the night Youth A and Youth E
were found in the bathroom but was aware of the situation.
6

Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024. Staff 4 reported Youth E was at the door of
the unit talking with Youth A who was standing outside. Staff 4
stated she was the only staff in the unit with Youth E, Youth F and
one other youth. Staff 4 reported she tried to get in-between
Youth E and the door so Youth E would not run out with Youth A.
Staff 4 stated she kept telling Youth E to close the door and to
stay in the unit, but Youth E just walked out the door and took off
running. Staff 4 described calling Supervisor 3 and Supervisor 3
went looking for Youth A and Youth E while Staff 4 stayed in the
unit. Staff 4 reported Youth E returned to the unit about 10
minutes later. Staff 4 denied seeing a staff with Youth A.
Staff 4 stated she did not know anything about Youth A and Youth
E being found in Camp One in a bathroom stall after going AWOL.
Staff 5 was working the night Youth E went AWOL and was
found in the bathroom of Camp One. Staff 5 no longer works at
the facility. I called Staff 5, and the message stated the number
had been disconnected.
Video Review
Video footage of 11/12/24 outside of Vassar House was reviewed.
Video shows Youth A at the back of Vassar House, and Youth E
walking out of the back doors towards Youth A. A car drives in
about 18 seconds later at the same time Supervisor 3 is seen
running out of the facility into camera view. Youth A turns and
walks away from the facility going out of camera view while Youth
E walks toward Supervisor 2 who is in the car. Supervisor 3
approaches the car and is seen walking back into the facility with
Youth E. The car turns around and is no longer seen on the
camera.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Reports dated 11/12/24 for Youth A and Youth E
were consistent with staff and Youth E’s interviews,
although Youth E denied having sexual intercourse with
Youth A. Youth A denied knowing Youth E and ever being
with Youth A.
• Incident Reports dated 10/28/24 for Youth A and Youth E
were consistent with Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2’s
interviews. Youth A and Youth E denied ever being found
together in Camp One.
• Wolverine Human Services Line of Sight Policy was
reviewed. The policy states staff are to “maintain adequate
7

supervision coverage and “line of sight” of all clients when
in direct supervision of clients. Within the line of sight
means that it is possible to reasonably visually distinguish
and recognize individuals.”
• Wolverine Human Services Truancy Policy and Procedure
was reviewed. The policy states if “non-supervising staff is
available, they will walk with the client and continue to
provide verbal support and redirection encouraging the
client not to truant”. In addition, the policy states “Staff will
immediately notify the Youth Care Specialist Supervisor on
duty when line of sight is lost, no later than 15 from loss of
line of sight (when youth is determined AWOL).”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, review of incident reports, and review of video footage,
staff did what they could do to follow the youth who ran off the
unit.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
